DataElement.preferredName: Smoking Cessation Nicotine Patch Nicotine Gum Use Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was use of a transepidermal patch designed to deliver nicotine, the addictive substance contained in cigarettes, directly through the skin and into the blood stream, or chewing gum containing nicotine used as a substitute for the active ingredient in tobacco to reduce the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking cessation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Smoking Cessation Nicotine Patch Nicotine Gum Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the use of a transepidermal patch designed to deliver nicotine, the addictive substance contained in cigarettes, directly through the skin and into the blood stream, or chewing gum containing nicotine used as a substitute for the active ingredient in tobacco to reduce the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking cessation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Discontinuation of the habit of smoking.

Concepts.definition: Discontinuation of the habit of smoking.

Property.preferredDefinition: A transepidermal patch designed to deliver nicotine, the addictive substance contained in cigarettes, directly through the skin and into the blood stream. Used for cessation of smoking.:A chewing gum containing nicotine used as a substitute for the active ingredient in tobacco. Nicotine chewing gum reduces the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking cessation.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A transdermal patch containing the alkaloid nicotine with nicotine replacement activity. Upon administration of the patch, nicotine is slowly released into the bloodstream and, although nicotine binds to nicotinic cholinergic receptors at the autonomic ganglia, adrenal medulla and at neuromuscular junctions as well, the binding of nicotine to the receptors in the central nervous system (CNS) appears to be responsible for the addictive nature of nicotine. Binding to CNS nicotinic acetylcholine receptors causes the release of the neurotransmitter dopamine which appears to be responsible for the addiction of nicotine. Administration of nicotine may prevent nicotine craving and may help with the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking cessation.
A chewing gum containing nicotine used as a substitute for the active ingredient in tobacco. Nicotine chewing gum reduces the withdrawal symptoms associated with smoking cessation.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
